@Heartofthorns 

Hey man, you seem to know your shit so maybe you can help me out.

I am using Maherz "Microsoft Windows 7 Ultimate SP1 (x64) Integrated September 2012," and everything seems to be working fine except all Microsoft/Windows programs. 

E.g. 
1. My windows update keeps telling me to update the same updates, no matter how many times they are successfully installed 
2. Microsoft Office, and all other Microsoft/Windows software (e.g. Windows Live Mail, Windows Live Messenger, etc) start installing themselves every time I try and use them, instead of opening the program.

Any help would be appreciated; should I try another version of Windows?

Thanks
Thanks Maherz, you're a highly valued PB'er in my book!

@ torrent_xlr8r
It's an issue with the Windows Update feature. 
Here's one of the fixes I found.
http://answers.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/forum/windows_7-windows_update/windows-update-repeatedly-prompting-to-install-the/1838bc26-19b9-4eb2-9f52-d96cf2e398e1
Try the 2nd answer, then the 1st one. Personally, I have the "Check for Updates but let me choose whether to download and install them" option ticked. I check which updates I have to install, then install them. See if that works for you.
Alternatively, if the problem persists, you could
a. Google for additional solutions (Search for windows update telling you to install same updates)
b. Post in Maherz's support forums (mentioned in the torrent description)
c. Post in piratebay forums ( https://forum.suprbay.org/  ) Many others will help you get help faster there.

@ torrent_xlr8r
Oops, forgot about the 2nd part of your question.
I searched google for it. Do you have multiple copies of Office installed? The Windows Installer Cleanup Utility fixed the problems for many of them who had the same problem as you (i.e. Office and Live messenger installing every time you run it)
Here's the link : http://support.microsoft.com/kb/290301
Again, you could google about the problem and follow their steps if you want ;)
Hope that helped.

UPDATE: For anyone who is experiencing similar symptoms (see original post).

1. Windows Update Issue: Use the steps/links posted by Heartofthorns 
2. Windows Installer Issue: Try the steps/links posted by Heartofthorns. If the problem persists, go to Program Files > Microsoft Office > Office 14 and find the relevant Office Applications (e.g. WINWORD) and create shortcuts from those, or add them to the start menu. Using these shortcuts should solve the problem.

my vista home edition is running 32 bit system but my machine says that it is able to run 64 bit. i downloaded the 64 bit version and it says it is not comaptible with my current system set up. how do i change the setup to be able to upgrade to 64 bit ? 
thanks for you help and uploads Maherz

@ leozdad
Are you trying to upgrade? You have a 32 bit operating system and want to install a 64 bit one, so you'll have to do a clean install instead. This torrent is 64-bit Windows 7. You really don't expect a 64 bit software to open in 32 bit operating system now do you? :P 

In short, if you want to install the 64 bit windows 7, you'll have to do a CLEAN install.  Search google/youtube, there's information and videos on how to do it if you don't know. And NO, you don't click on setup.exe to install it because that's what I'm thinking you did. You will have to burn this to a DVD and install it from there at boot.

@ rayomand96

@ Kunal_Sharma
Use this to activate it : https://thepiratebay.se/torrent/7463060/Windows_Loader_2.1.7_By_Daz

@ realful
Read the instructions in the torrent description mate. It says burn the iso file to a DVD with minimal speed (the lowest speed, so that all tracks on the dvd are written without errors).
1. If you're using ImgBurn to burn the DVD,
(i) Open ImgBurn
(ii) Click on "Write image file to disc"
(iii) Select the source where you have downloaded the .iso file (In short select the place where you have downloaded the file)
(iv) Click on Write (the big icon at bottom)
OR
2. If you're using Nero Burning ROM
(i) Open Nero Burning ROM
(ii) Click on New
(iii) Select "DVD" in the drop down menu (top left corner)
(iv) Select DVD-ROM (UDF)
(v) Click New and then drag the iso file there.
(vi) It will ask to burn the compilation, select yes. Then Burn it.
Note : Remember, burn at the lowest speed.

@ Heartofthorns

Alright, so this all worked fine and dandy.

I'm curious though; is it a good idea to turn on automatic updates or should I leave that off and only install certain updates? If so; which?

@ ketoto
AFTER activating you can set it to 'Download and Install updates automatically'. If you have some issues (some people get some problems with the automatic thing), or you are worried, then set it to 'Check for updates but let me choose whether to download or install them'. You can then choose which updates you want and so on and so forth.

@ QuincyORG
Did a quick google search. Apparently you can use it. Both have to be the same edition though. Like if your 32 bit win7 was professional, the 64 bit too has to be professional. Read this post for more information.
http://www.tomshardware.com/forum/25969-63-using-install-instead
If you experience black wallpaper I recommend you this app: http://coldlust.com/wallpaper/ which allows you to set your own wallpaper.
So does this work with installing through a USB? Cus Im tried that but dont work so dont know if thats not possible or if its something else

@ mongulenhetsig
It does work using USB.
1. I dunno about other software, but try using WinToFlash. http://wintoflash.com/home/en/  There is a video tutorial on the home page which shows you how to do it.
2. Is your bios set so that your first boot device is USB drive or Pen drive or Removable drive? If not, set it as first, then the computer will boot through the USB. First go into BIOS, then it should be somewhere under Boot > Boot Priority Options.
Hope that helps.
For those asking about Booting from usb flash drive -- http://images2.store.microsoft.com/prod/clustera/framework/w7udt/1.0/en-us/Windows7-USB-DVD-tool.exe

@ numbskull20
Dude, to install you have to boot the disk at boot i.e. when you start the comp. When you start the comp and the disk is in the DVD drive, you'll get a message on the screen "Press any key to boot from CD/DVD" Press any key and then it boots. Then you can install it. I have no idea what you are trying to do by mounting the image and installing it.
@Heartofthorns I already tried that. When I select my DVD drive in the boot menu I just get a black screen with a white cursor in the top-left corner.

@ numbskull20
In BIOS, go to Boot > Boot Device Priority. 
There select your CD/DVD drive as the first priority and hard disk as second. It should then boot from the DVD.

@ numbskull20
Sorry I may have misread your comment as I think you already tried that.

For burning the DVD, I hope you burned it at minimum speed. Sometimes if you burn at high speeds, some sectors may not get written and you may get an error. Also to burn, here's something I posted few comments ago : 
Burn the iso file to a DVD with minimal speed (the lowest speed, so that all tracks on the dvd are written without errors).
1. If you're using ImgBurn to burn the DVD,
(i) Open ImgBurn
(ii) Click on "Write image file to disc"
(iii) Select the source where you have downloaded the .iso file (In short select the place where you have downloaded the file)
(iv) Click on Write (the big icon at bottom)
OR
2. If you're using Nero Burning ROM
(i) Open Nero Burning ROM
(ii) Click on New
(iii) Select "DVD" in the drop down menu (top left corner)
(iv) Select DVD-ROM (UDF)
(v) Click New and then drag the iso file there.
(vi) It will ask to burn the compilation, select yes. Then Burn it.
Note : Remember, burn at the lowest speed. 

If the problem persists, ask on Maherz's forums (the link is in the torrent description) or in the piratebay forums (  https://forum.suprbay.org ). More qualified people might be able to help there.
